attributes.action: Put Food Technology back on the A and AS level options.
attributes.background: My friend wants to become a chef when she graduates university, however without an A level course in Food Technology she feels as though other older candidates, who had the option of this course, will be better prepared for the job, therefore more likely to be hired.

attributes.action: Only allow people who have served in the British Armed forces to vote.
attributes.background: Someone who has served their country and have been prepared to lay down their life should be allowed to vote. Therefore it should be a requirement that a person serves a minimum of 3 years in the armed forces to be eligible to vote in an election or referendum.

attributes.action: Require large companies to pay invoices within 30 days of invoice date.
attributes.background: Large companies impose onerous payment periods on small companies. Small companies are unable to resist because of their lack of power. This results in large companies using small companies as another source of funding.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, to add a further level of difficulty, the large companies have created a charge mechanism for invoices paid in a lesser time. It is quite common for large companies to pay smaller companies in periods of 90 - 120  days.

attributes.action: Make feeding owned cats a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Sign this petition to help get the law changed on feeding owned cats. 
Feeding someone else's cat can cause them to leave home, causing stress and upset to the beloved cats owners/family. 
At present the police/rspca/cats protection will not help, as there is no law on feeding another persons cat.

attributes.action: Parliament should vote to decide when we start negotiating to leave the EU
attributes.background: The UK must leave the EU through a well-ordered, timely negotiation. A rushed divorce will damage us both. Article 50.3 of the Lisbon Treaty gives us two years from notification before the Treaties expire. So we should not trigger Article 50 until Parliament votes to say we are ready to negotiate.
attributes.additional_details: The result of the referendum held on 23 June expressed the electorate's wish that the Government negotiate to Leave the EU. The events since make clear that neither the Government nor the Leave campaign have a plan for the UK's negotiation. So Parliament should exercise control over when the negotiation commences. A Parliamentary vote will also make it easier for the European Council to know when the UK has formally notified its intention to withdraw.

attributes.action: We want to delay invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty for at least 3 years
attributes.background: We believe the outcome of the EU Referendum was too close, with almost half over the electorate not wanting to leave the EU, that further investigation of the risks and changes that will occur to the UK need to be studied and popularised with debate and, if necessary more voting processes.
attributes.additional_details:
1) According to Google, “What is the EU?” is the 2nd most searched term about the EU since the announcement of the historic Brexit referendum. In the hours prior to the vote, Google says one of the top questions was “What is Brexit?”. This ignorance will likely cause further dismay to the millions in Britain who are understandably concerned about the massive uncertainty created by Thursday’s vote. 

2) Lack of any plan and renouncing of 'facts' by the biggest voices in the 'leave' campaign.

attributes.action: Give the rest of the UK a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain.
attributes.background: If Scotland decides on a 2nd referendum to leave or remain with the UK then the rest of the UK simultaneously should have a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain. If EITHER referendum indicate that Scotland should leave then they must leave the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The future of the UK should be decided by all of the residents of the UK and not just a minority.

attributes.action: Companies/organisations fined for hate speech in uniform/insignia or on premises
attributes.background: As a deterrant against post-referendum racism and to encourage a wider sense of collective social responsibility, we believe that penalty fines should be served on registered companies and organisations that own the uniform, insignia, premises or property in/with which an act of hate speech occurs.

attributes.action: Ensure participation in EU free trade, science, security, & environment programs
attributes.background: Now we have voted to leave the EU we must ensure that we will keep access to as many of the EU structures and programs that have been so beneficial to the UK over the years. We ask the government to negotiate access to these programs including free trade, science, security, & environment programs

attributes.action: A referendum should not be retaken for the same issue for at least 10years
attributes.background:
Following the recent vote leave result, a law should be passed preventing the Re-Polling of the same subject for a minimum period of time. I suggest this should be 10 years. 
Once the general public have had their democratic say, this should not be undermined by a second referendum.

attributes.action: make no cuts to Access To Work at the DWP.
attributes.background: Access to work is the only way to  help employers to employ  disabled people.  It must not be cut.
attributes.additional_details: My name is David wilkins and I am a totally blind and partially deaf Freelance Journalist.

attributes.action: A second referendum should be carried out in the event that the EU reforms.
attributes.background: Due to fears of other countries exiting the EU, a reformation may take place within the union. If this does occur, then the UK should have another opportunity to decide whether it wishes to remain in a reformed EU or not, prior to the triggering of Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland may well be having another referendum for their independence due to the changed circumstances between the UK and the EU. Similarly, should EU reformation occur, the circumstances will  have changed. Therefore, the UK should be given the opportunity to have a new referendum on its membership in the EU.

This should be carried out prior to the triggering of Article 50 to ensure that our position and influence in the EU is maintained.

attributes.action: Make a second EU referendum not up for debate for four years.
attributes.background:
The humans of the United Kingdom won a Democratic Vote to LEAVE the European Union. 

Please ensure by a legally binding contract all referendums on the same political-economical topic have four year gaps. We cannot have a second European Union referendum this close to the first.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Respect for moralistic democracy 
2. Post-pone second referendum for 4 years
3. Over-rule petition for second European Union referendum that is desired for this year.

attributes.action: A referendum to decide whether Norwich should become an independent nation.
attributes.background: After the result of the European Referendum, particularly the result in Norwich, we believe that Norwich has the infrastructure to become an independent nation, separate from the UK. After years of neglect from Westminster, Norwich has a better chance of growth if we leave the UK.

attributes.action: Explore further concessions to remain within the EU
attributes.background: We propose that the government explore all possibilities of gaining further concessions from the EU in order that the UK might remain a member nation. The ramifications of leaving the EU will be devastating for the continent as a whole. All options need to be explored prior to closing the door.
attributes.additional_details:
It is evident that the UK's current relationship with the EU was rejected by a very slim margin and it is important that this rejection is respected. However due to the size of the margin and a previous offer of further concessions from it would be undemocratic not to explore all available options as long as there is sufficient support for this petition. 

We owe it to future generations to explore all options before we inflict such a profound socioeconomic change on the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in the Prime Minister & the Chancellor of the Exchequer.
attributes.background:
Many electorate find the PM's behaviour & that of the Chancellor in the EU Referendum run up well below the standards expected of holders of high office.

Speculation, "Project Fear" & blackmail threats of raising taxes if we vote leave fall below what ordinary people require of their leaders.

attributes.action: Make all Diesel power plant applications require Environmental Impact Assessment
attributes.background: There are £175m in subsidies to build heavily polluting diesel power plants to provide the UK with backup energy generating capacity. Bizarrely these require less Environmental impact assessment than a single wind turbine.

attributes.action: Review campaign rules / media regulation on stigmatisation of demographic groups
attributes.background: In the UK, loosely regulated media and political propaganda has been used extensively to stigmatise and marginalise demographics, particularly those in minority groups. More should be done to protect groups and individuals from becoming targets for political or financial gain.
attributes.additional_details: Media content and political campaigns, including headlines, tag lines, articles or information and imagery, specifically taken out of context or construed with the intention to promote concern, fear and isolation of any group or culture that exists fairly under UK law, should be regulated to protect the public from attacks of violence and hatred.

attributes.action: Make a ban on using plastic packaging for fruit and veg.
attributes.background: Bring back paper bags and cardboard containers for fruit and vegetables. The amount of plastic waste generated annually in the UK is estimated to be nearly 3 million tonnes. An estimated 56% of all plastics waste is used packaging, three-quarters of which is from households. Free the cucumber!

attributes.action: To make August Bank Holiday Monday reclassified as ‘England Day.’
attributes.background: Given the rich and illustrious history of England, I propose that this day be given a new name and purpose and call it 'England Day?’ By a stroke of good fortune, historical evidence suggests that this time of year coincides with the emergence of England as single sovereign state, 1091 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Living in England is a great privilege and we should celebrate this. The transition from Bank Holiday Monday to England Day, couldn’t be simpler or more convenient, coming in late summer it would be part of the three-day holiday. This proposal is not competing with St George’s Day. This proposal seeks to promote a public holiday that already exists, by giving it status and relevance. If this idea appeals to you, please add your name to the petition.

attributes.action: Have all religious institutions in the UK declare their source of funding.
attributes.background: In wake of the countless terror attacks occurring on European soil, the issue of radicalisation of people in the UK is an increasingly important issue. To help combat this issue all religious institutions should declare where they receive their funding and who the recipients of their charity are.
attributes.additional_details:
After sources revealing the situation in Germany regarding approximately 200 mosques offered to be built by the Saudi Government (one I find deplorable in how it acts), I feel that it is time to see where mosques in Great Britain get their funding from and where their charity goes and whether it goes to funding extremism or not.

This petition also applies to religious institutions of other faiths as this is more than possible.

attributes.action: Raise a vote on no confidence in the Chancellor
attributes.background:
In the run up to the EU Referendum the Chancellor has acted in an irresponsible manner.

This petition is to raise a vote on no confidence on behalf of the public whom he represents. His behaviour is irresponsible and is misleading the British public.

attributes.action: Call on UEFA to ban & send Russian Fans home after violence against England fans
attributes.background: We clearly see evidence of Russian fans attacking England supporters. We believe that violence has no place in football. We're fed up of being highlighted as trouble makers. UEFA should send Russian fans home for their poor display towards other human beings to which the ECHR holds dear.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/HooligansTVi/videos/593950987452298/

attributes.action: Debate local community bank closures
attributes.background: It is time for a debate in parliament on the issue of closing small bank branches especially in rural areas. In England the HSBC is cutting rural branches and in Scotland it is the Royal Bank and the Clydesdale Bank. This must be stopped now..
attributes.additional_details:
Customers are paying the price for banks giving poor financial advice in the past by seeing the closure of smaller branches especially in rural areas.

These proposed closures effect a wide range of people from local businesses to those who are not internet savvy. 

These changes mean that people will no longer have face to face contact with real people. Should they want this contact they will have to travel some considerable distances to a larger branch to deposit cash or pay in cheques.

attributes.action: Postpone EU Referendum so Parliament can debate PM's/Chancellor Disaster Claims
attributes.background: The Prime Minister and Chancellor (and official bodies) have argued that a Brexit vote in the EU Referendum would be a disaster for the UK. The Cabinet and Parliament should have debated and agreed the consequences before a Referendum was actioned.  The PM, Chancellor and Cabinet are negligent.

attributes.action: To promote the creation of, and eventually join a united, single nation EU
attributes.background: For centuries, wars started and fueled by Nationalism, rivalry and hatred have ravaged Europe, allowing others to surpass Europe. Now we must trancend rivalry and Nationalism, much like China, and unify to stand more powerful on the world's stage. Continued in additional details.
attributes.additional_details: With a united EU the problems initially seen with the Euro would be ironed out, with a united fiscal and monetary policy. Allowing Europe to stand up to superpowers such as China and the US. While retaining through federalism the rights British citizens would expect.

attributes.action: Provide funding for childcare for deployed members of UK Armed Forces.
attributes.background: Members of all three Services are currently deployed throughout the world. Many of these are parents, and deployment places an extra, unacknowledged burden on the families of personnel. We are asking for provision to be made for "respite" childcare allowances for all families with a deployed parent.
attributes.additional_details:
Longer Separation Allowance (LSA) is currently paid to service personnel regardless of their family situation. As parents nowadays are expected to do an equal share it is unfair to parents with a deployed partner(or indeed ex partner with whom they share custody) to shoulder extra deprivations because of their partner's deployment. We ask therefore for a scheme to continue family life without undue burden.
See https://www.facebook.com/Help-Forces-Parents-821717114627365/ for more information.

attributes.action: Teach about the full LGBTQ* spectrum as part of the PSHE curriculum.
attributes.background: If the government made it mandatory for students to be taught about the LGBTQ* spectrum I feel it would drastically decrease bullying and ignorance, as well as making students possibly feel better about themselves if they understand that their feelings are normal.
attributes.additional_details: As a high school student myself I have noticed a distinct lack of education regarding LGBTQ* people, despite the fact that 1 in every 10 people is either lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender.

attributes.action: Make it legal for public facilities to keep a record of lost children.
attributes.background:
Did you know that there is no national lost child policy here in the UK?
Public facilities have no legal obligation to keep a record of lost children, so they could not tell you how often it occurs in their facilities and how long it took to reunite a lost child with it’s parent or guardian.
attributes.additional_details:
In recent surveys carried out;

1 in 5 children get lost or separated from their Parent/Guardian whilst on holiday each year. (Childline-NSPCC)

1 child is reported lost or missing every 3 minutes (Missingkids)

Almost 2 out of every 3 British Adults would hesitate to help a lost child because they fear being falsely accused of something sinister (Reuters)

In the last 2 years we have discovered that there is not one standard lost child policy in place throughout the UK (FollowtheBear.co.uk)

attributes.action: Change the railway lines for a faster train from Weymouth to London
attributes.background: The train takes 3 hours From Weymouth to London (138 miles) and it takes 2 hours 44 minutes from Liverpool to London (222miles).The old Victorian lines are not good enough for a faster train.

attributes.action:
Ban 0845 type numbers
Stop service providers charging customers contacting them
attributes.background:
Essential utility and service providers charge customers who need to contact them by phone
Identifying, reporting and resolving service delivery problems is an integral part of their business and should not constitute an additional source of revenue.
customer contact must be free - eg 0800 numbers
attributes.additional_details:
National service providers should provide customers who buy their utilities or products with free vectors of direct communication.  It is unethical to charge paying customers additional fees to speak to their service providers.
These, and other barriers to communication, serve to discourage customers from raising complaints and identifying problems. Opportunities for utility providers to monitor and maintain  service quality and delivery is therefore unfairly restricted and limited.

attributes.action: Change the law to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition is change the law, to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence, with specific minimum punishments for those convicted.
With social media becoming the main portal for people to share their lives with others, cyber bullying is on the increase.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullies must face harsher punishments. With self harming and suicide on the rise, social media truly does play a part with it being noted that all teenagers who socialise online will come across cyber bullying at least once. However, it is not just teenagers who are subjected to this online torture, with the internet becoming the new venue to host the modern day witch hunt. It is time that cyber bullies were held accountable and suitably sentenced for their actions.

attributes.action: Increase the resources allocated to child protection.  No more Ayeeshia's!
attributes.background: The case of Ayeeshia Smith is far from isolated. 1 child PER WEEK is murdered by their parent(s) in the UK. That simply has to stop. I'm calling on the Government to substantially increase the resources allocated to child social care and child protection, to try to make sure it never happens again
attributes.additional_details:
Ayeeshia Smith.  Baby Peter.
High profile names, for all the wrong reasons
But apparently, in the UK, one child per week is murdered by his or her parents.  Think about that: ONE CHILD PER WEEK KILLED BY THEIR PARENT(s).  Source:http://straightstatistics.fullfact.org/article/how-many-children-are-murdered-britain-every-year
In a supposedly civilised society, this simply cannot go on.  The government need to do whatever it takes - spend whatever is required - to make sure this never happens again

attributes.action: Increase fines and add 3 penalty points for illegally parking in disabled spaces
attributes.background: Abuse of Disabled parking keeps increasing. The disruption and physical pain of having to walk further because a non Blue Badge holder has taken a space, and those who use others badges because they want to get closer and not park further, now has to stop.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers only see the outside of a person, they dont feel the pain, or other effects that the so called invisible illness causes, which is why they were issued with the badge.  Drivers have not learnt the lesson and wont unless radical action is taken.  It it therefore proposed that any car owner without a badge or those who abuse a badge are fined not £60 but £300 and 3 points on the licence. The law is too leanient and has no effect. I ask everyone to support this MP's as well

attributes.action: That UK Government GOES AHEAD with distributing its leaflet on EU membership.
attributes.background: The UK government has made its position clear on EU membership of the UK.  The electorate deserve to have details of this position in order to be better informed about what will be the most important decision the UK makes this century.

attributes.action: Crash for cash drivers to be banned from driving for life
attributes.background: Cash for crash scams are costing British drivers £400m a year in increased insurance premiums and putting everyone at risk of serious injury or death
attributes.additional_details:
Crash for cash costs British insurers £400m a year, that's £400m that you will have to pay through your increased insurance premiums.
It's only a matter of time before someone is seriously injured or killed by these maniacs. 
If they are British citizens then ban them for driving for life, if they are non-UK nationals then deport them and ban them from ever entering the UK.

attributes.action: The UK to join the Eurozone
attributes.background: Without integration into the Eurozone the UK will always remain a fringe state of the European union, both economically and politically, with this integration tourism and trade between the other Eurozone countries will become more efficient and build stronger political ties with other major nations.

attributes.action: Force all motorcycle delivery riders to pass a full UK motorcycle driving test
attributes.background: Most delivery motorcycle riders are riding on L Plates. i.e. they have not passed a full motorcycle driving test. Their standard of riding is poor and they pose a high risk to other road users/pedestrians. They are using the roads for commercial purposes, they should be forced to pass a driving test

attributes.action: Make Defibrillators a Legal Requirement in Schools and Public Places
attributes.background: Just like fire extinguishers, defibrillators are life saving pieces of equipment, and yet to most, are unheard-of. Whilst they are beginning to appear in more and more public places, there aren't nearly enough located in places where fire extinguishers, for example, are mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: Cardiac arrest can occur anywhere, at any given time. In such a circumstance, time is vital. Having life-saving equipment nearby will undoubtedly play a huge part in saving the patient's life should this occur.

attributes.action: allow kids out of school for ten days per school year for holidays
attributes.background: Schools now fine us for taking kids out, the fine is often less than the savings made by taking a holiday during school term time so a fine isnt a deterrent.

attributes.action: Reallocate BBC licence fee to assist with the Chancellors budget plan.
attributes.background: UK households are expected to pay £147.50 per year to own a television raking in £3.7bn quite frankly ridiculous in 2016 and compares to the window tax of 1696. Money that would be better spent elsewhere, NHS, Education.... the deficit? We pay it anyway, I suggest we spend it where its needed.
attributes.additional_details:
When the Chancellor is still looking to make cuts £3.7bn would go a long way to help balance the books.

BBC finances report 2013/14 that they took in £3.7bn from households in the UK up £16m from the previous year. 

Follow the downloadable link to 'Full finance statement 2013-14' page 4 http://www.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/2014/executive/finances/summary-financial-statement.html 

BBC Finances report 14/15 - http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/pdf/2014-15/bbc-annualreport-201415.pdf

attributes.action: Make domestic violence a crime in its own right with clear sentencing guidelines
attributes.background: The impact of domestic violence on victims and children and the financial and emotional cost to society is huge. Violence is rarely an isolated event but part of a campaign. Again and again, perpetrators walk free from court  or receive nominal sentences: proportionate justice for victims is rare.
attributes.additional_details: Watch BBC's Behind Closed Doors and consider how often the sentence actually fits the crime and achieves justice for victims of DV. See www.cps.gov.uk/legal/s_to_u/sentencing_manual for common assault, actual bodily harm and grievous bodily harm. Unless the assault breaks the skin or bones, highest charge is ABH, max sentence is 5 years, likely 3 or less, out in half the time, minus remand time: likely released from court or very shortly after. Impact on victims and children is lifelong.

attributes.action: Make anyone who claims benefits do a few hours of community service a day
attributes.background: Anyone who claims benefits because they don't work, should be made to do a few hours of community service each day. I feel this would help as they are earning the money and giving back to the community, there is no reason for people to be getting money without working for it.
attributes.additional_details: This can also give people who are unable to find work added experience towards their CV, possibly making it easier for them to find a job in the future.

attributes.action: Provide the needed equipment to stop the collapse of the Mosul Dam.
attributes.background: The Mosul Dam is near collapse, with upcoming flooding threatening to cause the dam to break. If it did break, it's estimated that the ensuing flood could kill over 1,000,000 people, and displace millions more, causing a horrific level of death, and further increasing the scale of the Migrant Crisis
attributes.additional_details:
The Mosul Dam was built out of a material requiring continuous grouting in order to retain its structural integrity. In the aftermath of ISIS's capturing of the Dam, the grouting equipment was lost, and they don't have enough manpower to both fight ISIS and protect the dam. The Government should spend a section of its foreign aid/defence budget on providing this equipment, and in some manner freeing up the Peshmerga or the local population to regrout the the dam.

http://bit.ly/1RSTTb1

attributes.action: Completely ban Sunday trading for high-street retailers.
attributes.background: Sunday is a special day, families and communities gather on the seventh day to 'rest.' Unfortunately, the majority of employment contracts make workers who would participate in religious activities or spend time with their families have to go to work.
attributes.additional_details: It's sad to see that as Sunday trading laws have become more lenient, divorce rates have increased. Family time is now more unusual and many people refused to do such things as mow the lawn on Sundays until supermarkets broke the law and got their way.

attributes.action: Make a it criminal offence for a dog to worry livestock, e.g mauling lambs
attributes.background: Dogs mauling lambs is becoming more frequent.  Not only is the devastation they wreak an economic loss to the farmer but it is also a welfare issue because of the distress it causes to the ewes that lose the lambs. They should at least be afforded the same level of protection by law as wild animals

attributes.action: Educate 11-18 s in self-defence, financial management and emotional literacy.
attributes.background: Many students leave school unaware of how to manage everyday finances. Students need to be taught how to express their feelings.  The growth in eating disorders among young men shows this to be a priority.Introducing self-defence education will help protect young people from social dangers.

attributes.action: Provide funding, equipment, training & materials to repair to Iraq's Mosul Dam
attributes.background:
Mosul dam is in danger of catastrophic collapse potentially killing over 1,000,000 people. Continuous repairs have been severely curtailed due to past conflict. A contract for a specialist contractor to repair the foundations remains unsigned as of 29/02/16.

Inaction will result in loss of life.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosul_Dam

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/mar/02/mosul-dam-engineers-warn-it-could-fail-at-any-time-killing-1m-people

attributes.action: Give Ghurkas automatic citizenship.
attributes.background: Ghurkas are proud to serve this country and are a well respected members of the armed forces. Why should they have to apply for something and pay for it when they have already shown more loyalty to this country than some of the citizens who were born here.

attributes.action: Make life sentences in prison proper life sentences.
attributes.background: I propose for life sentences in prison to mean proper life sentences in prison!! Not just life sentences but in fact all prison sentences. If you break the law you should do the punishment!!  Life should mean life, 20 years should mean 20 years etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm fed up hearing people getting slaps on the wrist or people being allowed out on day release and absconding. 

Time to put things right and make prisoners pay the price.
